reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Enhancing Human Rights of Indigenous Girls and Women in Samburu Community

description.narrative: In Kenya, a lot of effort has been given to prevent e.g. female genital mutilation (FGM). Despite the efforts, FGM is widely executed for example in Samburu communities in Northern Kenya. The Samburu foster a pastoralist culture and way of living, which in cludes amongst others women’s and girls’ human rights violations. These traditions include polygamia, FGM and “beading”, a tradition aiming mainly to a sexual relationship between a young girl and a Samburu soldier. The project aims at improving pa rticularly reliazation of Samburu women’s and girl’s rights in Samburu and Laikipia provinces. Promotion of rights will be done primarily through information work, advocacy and training. The target groups, in addition to Samburu communities, include re levant stakeholders, organisations, human rights institutions, authorities, and police. Samburu Women Trust was founded in 2006 by a group of educated women. The organization was registered in 2009 as Samburu Women for Education and Environment Development Organisation SWEEDO and in 2012 as Samburu Women Trust. www.samburuwomentrust.org
